page.title: 18BERROW LEVERS
page.content: WHERE FARMERS ALONG THE COASTAL STRIP HAVE DECIDED TO ALLOCATE PART OF THEIR LANDS TO CATERING TO HOLIDAY FOLK,BEHIND THIS STRIP TRADITIONAL FARMIG HAS CONTINUES . THE FARMLAND IS ON A BELT OF MARINE CLAY WHICH IS A LITTLE HIGHER THAN THE PEAT MOORS WHICH ARE TO THE EAST ON THE SOMERSET LEVELS. THIS CLAY BELT IS DRAINED INTO THE RIVER AXE. IN RECENT EARS IMPROVED DRAINAGE DITCHES,OR RHINES,HAVE RESULTED IN A LOWERING OF THE WATER TABLE AND AS A RESULT ARABLE USE IS BECOMING INCREASINGLY POSSIBLE. IN THE PLACE OF TRADITIONAL PASTURE WITH THE ATTENDENT BLACK AND WHITE FRIESIANS,THE OCCASIONAL FIELD OF CEREALS NOW APPEARS.AT PRESENT 1 FARMER IS EXPERIMENTING WITH A SMALL PLANTATION OF APPLE TREES.
